🟦 3️⃣ app.py (Flask Backend)

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        role = request.form['role']
        email = request.form['email']
        password = request.form['password']

        # TEMP logic (later DB)
        if role == "teacher":
            return f"Welcome Teacher: {email}"
        elif role == "student":
            return f"Welcome Student: {email}"
        else:
            return "Invalid role"

    return render_template('login.html')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True)

🟦 2️⃣ app.py (Full STEP-2 Backend)

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request
import sqlite3
import random
import time

app = Flask(__name__)

# ---------- DATABASE ----------
def get_db():
    return sqlite3.connect("database.db")

def create_tables():
    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()

    cur.execute("""
    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS otp (
        code TEXT,
        created_time INTEGER
    )
    """)

    cur.execute("""
    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS attendance (
        student_email TEXT,
        timestamp INTEGER
    )
    """)

    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

create_tables()

# ---------- ROUTES ----------
@app.route('/', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        role = request.form['role']
        email = request.form['email']

        if role == "teacher":
            return render_template('teacher.html')
        elif role == "student":
            return render_template('student.html', email=email)

    return render_template('login.html')

@app.route('/generate_otp', methods=['POST'])
def generate_otp():
    otp = str(random.randint(100000, 999999))
    timestamp = int(time.time())

    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()
    cur.execute("DELETE FROM otp")
    cur.execute("INSERT INTO otp VALUES (?, ?)", (otp, timestamp))
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

    return f"OTP Generated: {otp} (Valid for 30 seconds)"

@app.route('/submit_otp', methods=['POST'])
def submit_otp():
    user_otp = request.form['otp']
    email = request.form['email']

    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()
    cur.execute("SELECT code, created_time FROM otp")
    data = cur.fetchone()

    if data:
        db_otp, created_time = data
        if user_otp == db_otp and int(time.time()) - created_time <= 30:
            cur.execute("INSERT INTO attendance VALUES (?, ?)", (email, int(time.time())))
            conn.commit()
            conn.close()
            return "Attendance Marked Successfully ✅"
    
    conn.close()
    return "Invalid or Expired OTP ❌"

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True)

🟦 2️⃣ Update app.py (Role Routing + Attendance View)

Replace app.py with this:

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request
import sqlite3, random, time

app = Flask(__name__)

# ---------- DATABASE ----------
def get_db():
    return sqlite3.connect("database.db")

def create_tables():
    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()

    cur.execute("""
    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS otp (
        code TEXT,
        created_time INTEGER
    )
    """)

    cur.execute("""
    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS attendance (
        student_email TEXT,
        timestamp INTEGER
    )
    """)

    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

create_tables()

# ---------- LOGIN ----------
@app.route('/', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        role = request.form['role']
        email = request.form['email']

        if role == "admin":
            return render_template('admin.html')
        elif role == "teacher":
            return render_template('teacher.html')
        elif role == "student":
            return render_template('student.html', email=email)

    return render_template('login.html')

# ---------- OTP ----------
@app.route('/generate_otp', methods=['POST'])
def generate_otp():
    otp = str(random.randint(100000, 999999))
    ts = int(time.time())

    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()
    cur.execute("DELETE FROM otp")
    cur.execute("INSERT INTO otp VALUES (?, ?)", (otp, ts))
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

    return f"OTP Generated: {otp} (valid 30s)"

# ---------- STUDENT SUBMIT ----------
@app.route('/submit_otp', methods=['POST'])
def submit_otp():
    otp = request.form['otp']
    email = request.form['email']

    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()
    cur.execute("SELECT code, created_time FROM otp")
    data = cur.fetchone()

    if data:
        db_otp, created = data
        if otp == db_otp and int(time.time()) - created <= 30:
            cur.execute("INSERT INTO attendance VALUES (?, ?)", (email, int(time.time())))
            conn.commit()
            conn.close()
            return "Attendance Marked ✅"

    conn.close()
    return "Invalid or Expired OTP ❌"

# ---------- VIEW ATTENDANCE ----------
@app.route('/view_attendance')
def view_attendance():
    conn = get_db()
    cur = conn.cursor()
    cur.execute("SELECT * FROM attendance")
    data = cur.fetchall()
    conn.close()
    return render_template("admin.html", records=data)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True)

🟦 STEP 6: CI/CD with GitHub Actions

🎯 GOAL OF STEP 6

After this step:

  • Every push to GitHub automatically:

    • Builds Docker image

    • Runs tests (if any)

    • Deploys the latest container to Azure VM (later)

  • Fully automated workflow

🔢 STEP 6 DETAILS

1️⃣ Create GitHub Actions Workflow

Inside your project folder:

bash
mkdir -p .github/workflows

Create file:

bash
.github/workflows/deploy.yml

2️⃣ deploy.yml (GitHub Actions Workflow)

yaml
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  build-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - name: Checkout Code
      uses: actions/checkout@v3

    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: 3.10

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        pip install -r requirements.txt

    - name: Build Docker Image
      run: |
        docker build -t cloud-attendance-app .

    - name: Test Docker Image (Optional)
      run: |
        docker run --rm cloud-attendance-app python -c "print('Docker test OK')"

    - name: Deploy to Azure VM
      uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v0.1.6
      with:
        host: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_IP }}
        username: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_USER }}
        key: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_SSH_KEY }}
        script: |
          docker stop attendance_container || true
          docker rm attendance_container || true
          docker pull cloud-attendance-app || true
          docker run -d -p 5000:5000 --name attendance_container cloud-attendance-app

3️⃣ Setup GitHub Secrets

Go to your repo → Settings → Secrets → Actions

Add these secrets:

Secret NameValue
AZURE_VM_IPYour Azure VM public IP
AZURE_VM_USERUsername of Azure VM (e.g., azureuser)
AZURE_VM_SSH_KEYPrivate SSH key for Azure VM

4️⃣ How CI/CD Works

  1. You push code to GitHub → main branch

  2. GitHub Actions runs workflow:

    • Checkout code

    • Install Python dependencies

    • Build Docker image

    • Deploy to Azure VM via SSH

  3. Azure VM container automatically updated

5️⃣ ✅ Test CI/CD

  1. Commit a small change:

bash
git add .
git commit -m "Test CI/CD"
git push

  1. Go to GitHub → Actions tab → See workflow running

  2. If green → deployed successfully

⚡ TIP

  • Make sure Docker is installed on Azure VM

  • Make sure SSH key works from GitHub

  • Use docker logs attendance_container on VM to debug

✅ STEP 6 CHECKLIST

✔️ GitHub Actions workflow created

Ah! I see exactly what’s happening in your screenshot 😅

The error is because the “Key pair name” field is empty and/or you may have used invalid characters. Azure has strict rules for resource names:

🔹 How to fix SSH Key Pair Name

  1. Key Pair Name Rules:

    • Only letters, numbers, and hyphens (-)

    • Cannot start or end with -

    • No spaces, underscores _, or special characters like ! @ # $ % etc.

✅ Examples of valid names:

vbnet
attendance-key
mysshkey1
vm-ssh-key

❌ Examples that fail:

perl
my key          → contains space
ssh_key#1       → contains _
"sshkey"        → quotes not allowed

  1. Steps to generate key pair:

  • Select “Generate new key pair”

  • Enter valid Key pair name (like attendance-key)

  • Azure will generate private (.pem) and public (.pub) keys

  • Download the private key securely — you’ll use it to SSH into VM

  1. Inbound Port Rules

  • Check SSH (22) → required to connect to VM

  • Later, also allow Custom port 5000 or HTTP (80) to access your Flask app

✅ Once you fix the Key pair name, the error will disappear and you can create VM successfully.

If you want, I can give you a step-by-step screenshot-style guide for creating the VM correctly, including key pair name, ports, and login details, so you can copy-paste without errors.

🔹 STEP 17: CREATE GITHUB ACTION FILE

On your local project:

bash
mkdir -p .github/workflows
nano .github/workflows/deploy.yml

Paste this FULL FILE 👇

yaml
name: Deploy to Azure VM

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Deploy to Azure VM
      uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v1.0.3
      with:
        host: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_IP }}
        username: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_USER }}
        key: ${{ secrets.AZURE_SSH_KEY }}
        script: |
          docker rm -f cloud-attendance || true
          rm -rf cloud-attendance
          git clone https://github.com/akishorekumar-1728/cloud-attendance.git
          cd cloud-attendance
          docker build -t cloud-attendance-app .
          docker run -d -p 80:5000 --name cloud-attendance cloud-attendance-app

Save & exit.

🔹 STEP 8.3: CREATE deploy.yml FILE

Paste ONLY THIS 👇 (do not change anything now)

yaml
name: CI-CD Azure VM Deployment

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Deploy to Azure VM via SSH
        uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v1.0.3
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_IP }}
          username: ${{ secrets.AZURE_VM_USER }}
          key: ${{ secrets.AZURE_SSH_KEY }}
          script: |
            docker rm -f cloud-attendance || true
            rm -rf cloud-attendance
            git clone https://github.com/akishorekumar-1728/cloud-attendance.git
            cd cloud-attendance
            docker build -t cloud-attendance-app .
            docker run -d -p 80:5000 --name cloud-attendance cloud-attendance-app

Save → close.
